"Fresh Air" damper
control (Type B)
Click here to return to the previous page
Exterior installation of
a "Fresh Air" Intake Vent
Fresh Air damper
adjustment (type A)
Refer to your manufacture warranty and homebuyer documentation provided with your unit
for specific adjustment placements.
Due to the fresh air vent code requirement in most states, some air draft is inevitable even in
the closed position.
VIDEO
A typical fireplace insert consists of these parts:

1) Flu Adjustment to allow smoke escape up the chimney
2) Fresh Air Vent for proper draft and combustion
3) Gas Logs or Log Lighter
4) Gas key (turns gas on)
5) Gas shutoff valve Located usually in the basement, attic or on the exterior.
"Fresh Air" damper adjustment can usually be found at the side of the fireplace when installed
See also: Chimney Maintenance
